N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 §§ 28-1.11 - Leave for quarantine

State Regulations

If an employee who is not personally ill is required to
remain absent because of quarantine, and presents a written statement of the
attending physician or local health officer proving the necessity of such
absence, such employee shall be granted leave with pay for the period of the
required absence, without charge against leave credits. Prior to return to
duty, such employee may be required to submit a written statement, from the
local health officer having jurisdiction, that return to duty will not
jeopardize the health of other employees. Notes
